New Records: Georgia qualify for Euro 2024, reaching their first major tournament.
Key Match Events: Georgia won 4-2 on penalties after a 0-0 draw in extra time.
Nika Kvekveskiri converted the decisive penalty for Georgia.
Giorgos Giakoumakis missed a crucial penalty for Greece.
Giorgi Mamardashvili saved Greece's first penalty from Anastasios Bakasetas.
Giorgi Loria, Georgia's substitute keeper, was shown a red card.
Khvicha Kvaratskhelia went off injured in extra time.
Konstantinos Mavropanos hit the bar with a header for Greece.
Zuriko Davitashvili's close-range effort was saved by Odysseas Vlachodimos.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Willy Sagnol made one change from the Luxembourg win, with Khvicha Kvaratskhelia returning from suspension.
Greece's Gus Poyet named the same side after the 5-0 thrashing of Kazakhstan in their semi-final.
Post-Match Reflections: Khvicha Kvaratskhelia expressed immense joy and gratitude towards the fans.
Georgia fans celebrated reaching their first major tournament.
Greece have now failed to qualify for the last two World Cup tournaments and three European Championships.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Boris Paichadze Stadium with an attendance of 44,000.
The home crowd displayed a banner reading 'Breaking news, Georgia make history'.
